net.padlocksoftware.padlock.license
Interface License

All Known Implementing Classes:
LicenseImpl
public interface License

Instances of the License interface are the primary means of customizing licenses. These can be created through the LicenseFactory class and imported/exported through the LicenseIO class.

All licenses must have a creation date and a start date. If neither are specified at the time of license instantation, the current date will be used for both. Licenses may also be given an optional expiration date. Licences may also be set with a floating expiration date, which is the period of time a license is valid after the first time it's run through the validator. This is the easiest method of creating a time limited day demo.

Licenses can be given any number of customizable properties. The contents of these properties are of no concern to the validator, they exist strictly for customer defined plugins and the customer application. Padlock does guarantee the validity of these properties, however. If any property key or value is changed, added, or removed the license will fail to validate.

Licenses are freely modifiable until they've been signed with a private key, at which point they act (and should be treated as) an immutable class. Any attempt to modify a signed license will cause an exception to be thrown. See the various method docs for details.

Author:
Jason Nichols (jason@padlocksoftware.net)

Method Detail

cloneLicense

License cloneLicense()
Return a new License instance based off the current instance. The new license is identical to the original, with the exceptions that the new license is not signed, and that the creation date will be the current system time.

Returns:
A copy of the current license instance, minus the signature.

getCreationDate

java.util.Date getCreationDate()
Get the license creation date. This is may differ from the license start date.

Returns:
The creation date of the license.

getExpirationDate

java.util.Date getExpirationDate()
Get the license expiration date. This is the date at which the license is no longer valid. This is not related to the floating expiration period, but may be used in conjunction with it.

Returns:
The expiration date of the license, or null if the license has no expiration date.

getStartDate

java.util.Date getStartDate()
Returns the start date of the license validity period.

Returns:
The license start date.

getFloatingExpirationPeriod

java.lang.Long getFloatingExpirationPeriod()
Returns the period of time remaining before the floating expiration period is reached. This is distinct from a hard coded expiration date in that the float period doesn't start until after the first time a license is validated.

Returns:
The floating expiration period for the license, or null if none has been set.

getProperties

java.util.Properties getProperties()
Get all custom properties defined for this license.

Returns:
All custom properties, or an empty Properties object if none have been added.

getProperty

java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String propertyName)
Get a specific custom property for this license.

Parameters:
propertyName - The name of the property to return.
Returns:
The value for the given property, or null if it has not been set.

getProperty

java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                             java.lang.String defaultValue)
Get a specific custom property for this license.

Parameters:
propertyName - The name of the property to return.
defaultValue - The default value to return if the property does not exist
Returns:
Either the property's value in the license, or the default value.

getLicenseSignatureString

java.lang.String getLicenseSignatureString()
Gets the license signature string. The signature string is the cryptographic signature resulting from the DSA signing process. When a license is validated, this signature string should match the one computed by the Validator.

Returns:
The license signature String, or null if the license has not yet been signed.

getLicenseSignature

byte[] getLicenseSignature()
Returns a byte coded version of getLicenseSignatureString()

Returns:
The license signature, or null if the license has not yet been signed.

isSigned

boolean isSigned()
Returns the license signature status

Returns:
True if the license has been signed, or false otherwise.

getLicenseVersion

int getLicenseVersion()
Returns the license version. The 1.x series of Padlock is known as version 1, while the 2.x branch is known as version 2.

Returns:
The license version number.

getHardwareAddresses

java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getHardwareAddresses()
Returns the set of MAC addresses that this license is locked to.

Returns:
The address set, or an empty set if this license isn't locked to any addresses.

setStartDate

void setStartDate(java.util.Date d)
Set the start date for this license. This can be any date in the past, present or future. The only restriction is that the start date must not be after the license expiration date, if one is set.

Parameters:
d - The license start date.

setExpirationDate

void setExpirationDate(java.util.Date d)
Set the expiration date for this license. This can be any date in the past, present or future. The only restriction is that the expiration date must not be after the license start date.

Parameters:
d - The license start date, or null to unset the expiration date.

setFloatingExpirationPeriod

void setFloatingExpirationPeriod(java.lang.Long period)
Sets the licenses floating expiration period, which is the number of milliseconds after the initial validation when the license will expire.

Parameters:
period - The length of the license validity period, in milliseconds.

addProperty

void addProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                 java.lang.String value)
Add a custom property to the license. This can be retreived using getProperty().

Parameters:
propertyName - The unique property name;
value - The property value, or null to remove this property from the license.

addHardwareAddress

void addHardwareAddress(byte[] address)
Add the given byte array to the list of MAC addresses this license it restricted to. The byte array is expected to be 6 bytes long.

Parameters:
address - The byte values of the hardware address to add,

addHardwareAddress

void addHardwareAddress(java.lang.String address)
Same as addHardwareAddress, only using a string encoded address with or without colons.

Parameters:
address - The mac address in the form of 123456789abc or 12:34:56:78:90:ab.

removeHardwareAddress

void removeHardwareAddress(byte[] networkInterface)
Remove the given hardware address from the license hardware list.

Parameters:
networkInterface - The byte encoded interface to remove.

removeHardwareAddress

void removeHardwareAddress(java.lang.String address)
Remove the given hardware address from the license hardware list.

Parameters:
address - The hardware address to remove, in String form.
